attributes.action: Require employers to protect employees with food allergies at work
attributes.background: The government must make a specific law making it clear that employers have a legal duty to protect employees with serious food allergies.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of people are uneducated about food allergies and the severity of them. A work place should be a safe and comfortable environment but for many people like myself this lack of knowledge means these foods may be brought in, causing a risk of anaphylaxis, a life-threatening condition.
 
Employers should ensure staff are creating a safe environment for their colleagues and this includes not consuming foods that others have severe allergies too, this can be done by educating people on allergies and anaphylaxis. I have been working for a company for 5 years and still have colleagues who eat nuts around me causing me to go in to anaphylactic shock.

attributes.action: A residency qualification of 5 years to sufficient for full UK voting rights.
attributes.background: My Swedish wife has been here for 36 years and is barred from voting in GEs and referenda. This is an affront to any acceptable standard of democracy. She works and pays taxes here, and has had a National Insurance Number for many years. Sign if you can see that this is deeply undemocratic.
attributes.additional_details: It is simple. There should be no taxation without representation, and people who have shown their commitment to the UK for 5 years or more are, in my view, entitled to have a say in how the country is governed. Anything else is clearly unfair, undemocratic, and unacceptable.

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares to anyone under 18, by law.
attributes.background: The legal age of adulthood is 18 in the UK. Yet many transport operators require children of a certain age to buy a full-fare ticket, intended for adults. Young people cannot work full-time and we should be supporting them, rather than offering fares which exploit and disadvantage children.
attributes.additional_details: Most trains in the UK are an example of how the fares system fails to support those who are in full-time education, and who are the future of our country. Fares continue to be structured as though it is the last century, when far less 16 and 17 year olds were in education. Both bus and train operators are guilty of exploiting young people, through fares and fines. A new law would create a sense of consistency and equality for all children using public transport in the UK.

attributes.action: Create a veteran status with special benefits
attributes.background:
These benefits are to include: 
A higher tier housing allowance and priority over available homes. 
Food and amenities monthly allowance. 
Free public transport. 
0% Tax on PAYE or anything purchased in the UK. 
0.00 to be paid in council tax upon receiving Veteran status.
attributes.additional_details: Also investment by the government for Veteran communities in the UK, where Veterans can live and support each other, with access to Veteran medical and Dental care, Care workers for the elderly and counselling which is required to have a mandatory 6 monthly or yearly check-up.

attributes.action: Raise concerns with the French Government regards concert on Sword beach
attributes.background: Prevent / reconsider "The International Concert for Freedom" being on held on Sword beach in Normandy; A recognised scene of Battle on D-Day 1944. A location where veterans / families return to pay respects, the remains of former veterans (Ashes) are laid and where the fallen remain.
attributes.additional_details: On the 6th June 2019, the 75th commemorations of the Normandy landings. It is proposed by the Ouistreham commune , the Calvados department in Normandy with the organisers of "The International Concert for Freedom" to hold a concert under the guise of a commemorative event. On the beaches designated Sword beach on D-Day. The organisers predict 1 million guests. This petition is to prevent the concert been held on this sensitive area /scene of battle and reconsider its location.

attributes.action: Railcard for armed forces veterans
attributes.background: As a serving member of the armed forces a railcard is available for purchase which provides for 33% off rail fares. A veterans' railcard should also be introduced giving the same benefit.

attributes.action: New EU membership referendum asking leave or remain until 55% majority reached
attributes.background: Given there are controversies, divisions and near impasse after the narrow simple majority in 2016 EU referendum to leave, with more information available Parliament to restore pre 2016 status and legislate for new same referendum until a minimum 55% threshold is reached by either side
attributes.additional_details: The 1974 referendum to join EU had 67% majority but 2016 EU referendum to leave was decided by a narrow simple majority of 51.9% leaving bitterness and deep divisions as both sides accuse the other of misleading the public. A divided nation fears walking into an unknown future. With clearer information now on consequences of remain or leave the 2016 outcome be set aside and another referendum could unite people behind a decisive outcome until a minimum majority of 55% of those voting is reached.

attributes.action: Force all Govia Rail Franchises to freeze ticket prices for at least one year.
attributes.background: Since the introduction of the Govia Thameslink Rail Plan 20/20 timetable, we the long suffering commuters, have had to endure a train service not fit for purpose. There are numerous social media accounts of stranded passengers, overcrowding, and services cancelled with little or no notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Only when pressurised by the Commons Select Committee, did Govia Thameslink admit to knowing in advance, that their Rail Plan 20/20 timetable wouldn’t work. They didn’t have enough fully trained drivers or a balanced staff roster in place. 

What is unforgivable is their total disregard for their passengers, and the mental and physical distress this is causing. 

The Department of Transport should instruct Govia to freeze all ticket price increases for a period of not less than one year.

attributes.action: To provide acceptable levels of border control staff & e-gates at UK airports
attributes.background: Visitors & UK residents arrive at UK airports to face queues of over two hours to enter the UK.  They face unmanned desks and e-gates closed or not working.  Visitors arriving to do business, invest or spend on holiday are given an appalling experience that is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: It is understood that the government has not been prepared to invest in the e-gates or manning of Border Force desks, leaving airports, airlines and ultimately the public to either pick up the bill or leave the facilities empty resulting in queues and unhappy investors in the UK economy.  Border Force must be properly funded, properly managed and a credit to the UK.  First impressions are lasting impressions, a two hour queue is the latter.

attributes.action: Reduce all fares on Govia Trains by 25% until the service promised is delivered.
attributes.background: The Rail2020 plan was meant to help all those people who live outside London to have a better, more frequent and reliable service. It was promised that there would be more trains during peak times and a better service.  until the service delivers what it promised all fares should be reduced by 25%.

attributes.action: Seek an Independent Inquiry into the death of Kishni Mahay
attributes.background: For the last 29 years our family have vigorously believed that a gross injustice has reigned over my mother’s death. An unbiased Independent inquiry would conclusively reveal justice and bring Kishni Mahay dignity in death. She will be able to rest in peace and we can achieve the closure we yearn.
attributes.additional_details: Kishni Mahay was killed by a police patrol car. We believe that the car was not being driven appropriately according to the road conditions. We believe that key facts were missed by the investigating team (Police Complaints Authority: PCA). The Police Officer was never prosecuted. The post mortem examination declared that Kishni Mahay was an alcoholic with Cirrhosis of the Liver, which may have confused the inquest jurors.

attributes.action: Add an exemption to the Ivory Bill for the Sikh Kirpan.
attributes.background: Baptised Sikhs are permitted by UK law to carry the ceremonial knife called the Kirpan. Many Kirpans are inherited heirlooms & most historic, antique versions contain ivory handles. We want exemption for Sikhs to be able to carry previously, legally purchased antique Kirpans under the new ivory law.
attributes.additional_details: We do not support the trade in ivory, we are only requesting protection & continued freedom of use of any antique Kirpan legally owned before the new ivory law comes into action. As mentioned, historic Kirpans could contain more than 10% ivory. As many practicing Sikhs will continue to travel abroad, we are very concerned that the Kirpan, if constructed of ivory may be confiscated or destroyed. We request that suitable exemptions are put in place to avoid disruption to the Sikh community.

attributes.action: End dog on dog attacks
attributes.background:
Currently there is no law to protect our dogs which is enforced, when a dog attacks or kills another dog. 
The government need to update the dangerous dogs act 1991 and make the owners liable for prosecution if an attack happens.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 19th August 2018 our blind 14yr old toy poodle was savagely attacked by two American bulldogs. She was playing in the long grass when the two dogs saw movement and hunted her. The dogs were too strong and she couldn’t be saved. 
We need to fight to save all other dogs lives from dangerous dogs which are not correctly restrained. 
We can’t bring Emma or the other dogs who have lost their lives back but we can try and change the future. 
#EmmasLaw

attributes.action: Make a crime that is motivated by prejudice against homelessness a hate crime.
attributes.background: Homeless people are some of the most vulnerable members of society, but face the risk of physical and verbal attacks by members of the public daily. Homeless people are at risk of having their possessions stolen and subjected to emotional abuse just because they live in absolute poverty.
attributes.additional_details: These are people who are discriminated against because they are affected by poverty. They should be protected by the same laws that protect people from other kinds of hate crimes.

attributes.action: Do NOT introduce the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' to the UK. Decriminalise instead!
attributes.background: The proposed implementation in the UK of the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' in regards to sex buyer laws criminalises the client and not the sex worker. However, this criminalisation punishes the sex worker by abolishing their market and source of income, whilst making trafficked women harder to find.
attributes.additional_details: Sex workers and women who are forced to sell sex are two separate groups.Yet the Nordic Model assumes that the act of buying sex is inherently violent towards women,this is wrong.Currently for sex workers it's (and should always be),the individual's choice who to have sex with and/or charge for sex. A separate market exists for trafficked women & children and a blanket ban won't help. http://theconversation.com/the-nordic-model-of-prostitution-law-is-a-myth-21351

attributes.action: 16 and 17 year olds to be allowed to vote in a referendum on the Brexit deal.
attributes.background: if Parliament supports a final referendum on the deal to leave the EU it is important that young people are listened to through the ballot box. It happened in the Scottish Independence Referendum and there are no barriers to it happening in a referendum on the final EU deal.

attributes.action: Allow carers who have SGO/parental responsibility paid time off work
attributes.background: We are currently fostering a baby under kinship care however looking at applying for special guardianship and need to be able to give him the time he deserves without being penalised financially
attributes.additional_details: You get paid leave from work if you give birth to a child or adopt a child.  If you gain parental responsibly any other way eg SGO which comes under the adoption act there is no paid time to bond, get them settled in thier forever home and for the new parents.  These children and parents have the same rights responsibilities and needs of any parent/child often more so depending on the child's background.  I believe there should be leave similar to adoption leave allowed in these circumstances.

attributes.action: Make cyclists have a registration plate, tax, Mot and insurance
attributes.background: We have been getting very heated with each other over push bikers. As if they crash into you and then they ride off there would be no proof of it or any way to prosecute them.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of filtered cigarettes across the UK.
attributes.background: It is widely accepted that cigarette filters have little to no health benefits for smokers. Many understand that cigarette filters contain large amounts of toxic chemicals but most people do not realise they contain plastic and are the biggest ocean pollutant on the planet.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 4.5 trillion cigarette butts find their way into the environment every single year. It's estimated that a cigarette butt will take 10-12 years to break down.

By banning cigarette filters we could eliminate a massive percentage of plastic/litter finding its way to our streets, rivers and oceans almost overnight benefiting us, wildlife and the environment. It's likely to encourage more smokers to give up too.

attributes.action: Probate Fees in England/Wales should remain a low flat fee covering admin costs.
attributes.background:
A present a flat fee of £215 applies. From April 2019: Up to £50K: no charge. 

£50K - £300K: £250. £300K - £500K: £750. £500K - £1m: £2,5K. The Min of Justice reckons 80% of estates won't pay more than £750. A rise of over £500! This is a stealth tax on death, not a fee to cover admin costs.
attributes.additional_details:
Probate fees should not help fund courts & tribunal systems. The proposed hike is unjustified. 

https://www.moneyobserver.com/news/probate-costs-could-hit-ps6000-banded-fees-confirmed

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tax/news/government-confirms-new-death-tax-will-see-estates-paying-3770pc/?li_source=LI&li_medium=li-recommendation-widget

https://www.accountancydaily.co/probate-fees-rise-ps6k-largest-estates

https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/article-6356603/New-death-tax-hit-grieving-families.html

attributes.action: Reduce VAT and explore alternatives to business rates across the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Owner of Michelin-starred restaurant Pied-à-Terre, David Moore, wants action to be taken to save businesses and jobs with a thorough review of a sales tax as an alternative to business rates and a reduction on VAT for food sales.
attributes.additional_details: The restaurant businesses on the High Street which employ hundreds of thousands of people in the UK are trying to support their families all over the country and need urgent help to survive.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys in children’s fast food meals.
attributes.background: Fast food restaurants produce billions of non essential plastic toys every year to give away in children’s meals. The toys which are packed in plastic bags are usually thrown away before the children even leave the restaurant.
attributes.additional_details:
Children seem to enjoy the toys more than the meals but fast food outlets could change this by offering more variety and healthier choices. They could perhaps create paper comics as an alternative to the toys and these could be recycled. 
There is too much waste in the world and too much plastic going to landfill and ending up in our oceans. Fast food outlets would make a massive difference if they cared more about the plastic waste that they produce.

attributes.action: Get rid of the 5% luxury tax that women have to pay on sanitary products.
attributes.background: It is discrimination against women to have to pay a luxury tax on a necessity, as men do not have to pay for any necessities. Many young girls miss out on their education because they're unable to afford sanitary items to wear.
attributes.additional_details: Our goal is to get rid of the 5% luxury tax that women have to pay on sanitary products as people can't afford it.

attributes.action: Reform company car tax for diesel and ultra-low emission vehicles.
attributes.background:
Support UK fleets, businesses and drivers by:
- Reducing the 4% diesel company car tax levy until RDE2 testing is commonplace.
- Introduce the ULEV company car tax bands in April 2019, not 2020.
- Tax bands to at least 2022/23 are needed now, including how they will address higher WLTP figures.
attributes.additional_details: For more information about the benefits of the UK's company car sector, and why it needs additional support, click here: https://fleetworld.co.uk/save-the-company-car/

attributes.action: Please protect our treasured St Helens beach huts with Listed Structure status.
attributes.background:
8 October 2018 Isle of Wight County Press article "The Isle of Wight's historic railway carriage beach huts at centre of redevelopment discussions" http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16967980.the-isle-of-wights-historic-railway-carriage-beach-huts-at-centre-of-redevelopment-discussions/
 Save our beach!
attributes.additional_details: The beach huts alongside St Helens beach are old railway carriages and part of our national heritage. They deserve to be preserved and conserved against the whims and fancies of developers. Why should we have to destroy our village life to suit the tastes of developers? These beach huts are part of the "setting" of St Helens Fort, a scheduled monument and Listed Building Grade II. As such this should be considered as part of the Historic Environment and be properly protected by the Government.

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to reconsider its proposed marketing restrictions for P2P lenders
attributes.background: The recent proposed changes contained within the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)'s consultation on peer-to-peer lenders proposes that obstacles be placed in the way of investor involvement, unless investors can prove they are sophisticated, a HNW, a professional or under professional advisement.
attributes.additional_details:
Peer-to-peer lending was always meant to embody the idea that the old financial order was fundamentally not fit for purpose and needed renewal. For example if banks didn’t pass on interest rate rises to savers, online lenders would. And they have. 
The FCA should rethink its approach and trust the investor to make the right decision about what they do with their investments. Better regulation of peer to peer lending is required but narrowing down choice isn’t the right way to go.

attributes.action: Require all fast food restaurants & coffee shops to use paper lids on drinks.
attributes.background: The UN has cofirmed that there is just 12 years left to reverse the damage done to our climate. Plastic is a huge contributing factor to the damage that has already taken place. Following paper straws, we need to introduce paper lids to reduce unnessecary plastic usage!
attributes.additional_details:
United Nations Report: http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/

https://www.theloop.ca/we-only-have-12-years-left-to-fix-climate-change-before-were-totally-screwed/

How plastic is damaging the earth:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/environment/plastic-how-planet-earth-environment-oceans-wildlife-recycling-landfill-artificial-a7972226.html%3famp

BBC’s “Drowning in Plastic” documentes the damage that has occurred through plastic usage.

attributes.action: Improve the treatment and diagnosis of Thoracic Outlet Syndrome on the NHS.
attributes.background: TOS is a condition in which the flow of blood or nerves are restricted to one or both arms. Despite the fact it creates debilitating and disabling symptoms, at present the current understanding and treatment on the NHS is very poor, often taking several years to even diagnose, if at all.
attributes.additional_details:
It can cause a range of symptoms including the pulse completely dropping from the limb as soon as it is raised, to extreme weakness and pain in the affected side. In rare cases it can even lead to blood clots and strokes.

I have personally been experiencing symptoms for 3 years, having initially been told by a doctor I was "imagining" my symptoms, which is a very common, devastating reaction faced by sufferers. The condition is serious and often requires the removal of a rib to treat.

attributes.action: A Public Inquiry into the Management and Governance of the UK's Universities
attributes.background: 2017/18 saw the longest university strike ever, over slashed pensions. Students lost classes,  staff  pay.  An independent Joint Expert Panel has found small tweaks, as suggested by staff, would save the pension scheme. The strike was only due to university bosses' insistence on confrontation.
attributes.additional_details:
UK university Vice Chancellors get mega-salaries.  Many unis now employ more administrators and managers than lecturers and researchers.  There is a massive secret network of lobby groups/ consultancies.  This superstructure is all funded by the debt enforced on our children as student loans, and taxpayer’s money. Yet the expert panel's findings suggest it is not up to the job.

A Public Inquiry is need to restore good teaching and research for the public good in Britain's Universities.

attributes.action: Stop sending our Foreign aid money to countries with no animal rights
attributes.background: We give huge sums of our taxes to countries like China, Vietnam, Pakistan etc where animals both domestic and farmed are given no protection whatsoever from abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Countless petitions to these Governments pleading to stop atrocities like Yulin Dog Eating 'Festival' or Vietnamese slaughtering cattle with a sledgehammer seem to fall on deaf ears. I propose we stop our taxes being donated as foreign aid to these countries and I believe that 'money talks' so perhaps they will listen!
Sign and share please, let's see where this goes!

attributes.action: Increase funding for schools with SEN students.
attributes.background: We are a GCSE Citizenship group and we feel that, due to the recent school budget cuts, Special education needs students are not getting the full support that they deserve, because the funding has been cut for them.
attributes.additional_details:
Our school has been greatly effected by the cuts, and we are now having to use other students money to support these SEN students. If this cause was bought before Parliament, we could increase the spending on SEN students and they would not have to suffer any more than they already are. We have lost £279 per student and we are losing more to help other students.

Our aims are to get as many signatures as possible and hopefully get local MP's behind us.
Please help us.

attributes.action: Abolish TV Licence
attributes.background: A lot of people forced to pay for a TV Licence and they are not watching BBC on live broadcast or online. TV Licence was founded when the BBC was the only broadcast channels, right now there is a lot of other channels to watch on TV so why do we have to keep paying if we are not watching BBC?

attributes.action: Allow HRT to be prescribed free of charge.
attributes.background: We have an aging workforce and women are now working through the Menopause which is not a life choice or self inflicted. HRT is a lifeline to many, allowing them to remain in employment. Despite working many struggle financially so receiving HRT free of charge would help the women and the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Baroness Altham published a report on women in the workforce and stated older women (aged 50 to 64) are now more likely to be in employment with the proportion of those in jobs reaching a record high in 2015 of 64.2% compared to just 41.9% in 1985.
Menopause usually starts between 45 and 55 so many women  are trying to remain in work while dealing with Menopause symptoms that can be  disabling. For many HRT allows them to remain productive and reduces the risk of various other health conditions.

attributes.action: Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field to be used when selling bicycles on web sites.
attributes.background: Many stolen bicycles are sold on second hand web sites. It is almost impossible to identify bikes on these sites. Therefore a Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field must be filled in when selling bicycles on these sites, without the number being given the item cant be advertised e.g. Ebay Gumtree etc.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to carry any knife in public without good reason.
attributes.background: A knife point can cause serious injury or kill at a depth of just 2cm . Therefore why is it legal to carry a knife that has a folding blade with a cutting edge 3 inches long or less. No knife should be carried on UK streets.

attributes.action: Urge the Libyan Government to appoint a different Libyan ambassador to London.
attributes.background: It has been announced that the Libyan unity government in Tripoli has appointed  a new Libyan ambassador to London, this designation has brought lots of outrage within the Libyan community in the UK as well as in Libya .
attributes.additional_details: As individual and part of the Libyan- British community in the UK,we would like to raise a great concern over the new designation role with the UK government, although enabling him for such vital position would cause lots of problems in the future relationship between the two countries and bring lots of shame and valuations to the Libyan people’s human rights. A position of Ambassador to a state like Great Britain should be given to someone who is qualified.

attributes.action: Change Child Benefit cap from £60k sole earner to £100k joint or single income
attributes.background: The rules introduced in 2012 that child benefit should be capped at £60,000 are fundementally flawed. A single income of £60,000 means that you are not entitled to any child benefit yet 2 parents working can earn £98,000 and get the full entitlement.
attributes.additional_details: A single earner of £60k will be on a 40% tax bracket with no child benefit yet 2 parents can earn £43k each at 20% and get full child benefit. Families work extremely hard to enable one of the parents to look after their children during their youngest years rather than a stranger but the government seems to want to make this extremely difficult. There is also very little public Information to inform you that you lose this when you hit £60k meaning you end up in debt to the inland revenue.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cot bumpers in the UK
attributes.background: Cot bumpers are extremely dangerous and have taken innocent childrens lives. They are not needed and most of them are made to be pretty to entice you to buy them.

attributes.action: Include black role models as part of history education throughout the year.
attributes.background: Black history is not a compulsory part of UK education – we are asking the government to look at the positive impact of including important black role models as part of history education throughout the academic year.

attributes.action: Provide annual Breast Screening and handheld mammogram machines at GP Surgeries.
attributes.background: For many years women have been offered Breast Screening every 3 years. It is a National Statistic that women have been diagnosed with Breast Cancer between Screenings and most are deemed as not 'at risk' i.e., they do not have family history. Cancer is indiscriminate and can occur between Screening.
attributes.additional_details: Recently several women who have this disease found a change in their breasts themselves, had they not, their lives would be at risk of a higher Stage of Cancer or die before their next scheduled Screening. 3 years is too long, it is the difference between life and death. Other Countries do mammograms annually logically Early Stage treatment must cost less than treatment if left. There are cheaper handheld mammogram machines which could be put in GP Surgeries so annual Screening can be supported.

attributes.action: Give my parents visa to attend my graduation ceremony and see my wee girl Nara
attributes.background: Please help me have my parents attend my graduation ceremony and meet their new born granddaughter Nara. My parents require a visa to enter the UK and their recent visa applications have been refused. There is no right of appeal, hence I have started this petition. I believe the refusal is unfair
attributes.additional_details:
Their visit visa applications have been refused for what I believe wrong reasons.
Both my parents are over 60 years old and have lived their entire lives in their hometown, yet this is what they have received in the refusal letter:
“Given this, I am not satisfied that you are settled or established, or that you have shown sufficiently strong social or economic ties to your country of residence...”
Really?! Then what would be considered as “settled” or having “strong social or economic ties”?!

attributes.action: Take greater action to improve young people's mental health in the UK
attributes.background: More than 100,000 14-year-olds in the UK self-harm. We the undersigned call for Parliament to respond by adopting new Children's Society guidelines (such as requiring a counsellor in every secondary school) so all young people can access the support for their mental health they need.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/good_childhood_summary_2018.pdf
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-45329030
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/aug/29/quarter-of-14-year-old-girls-in-uk-have-self-harmed-report-finds

attributes.action: Make it illegal for online platforms to allow sales of CITES-protected species
attributes.background: While it's illegal to buy and sell seahorses (dead, alive, whole or in part) within Europe, online platforms flout this law by hosting adverts for their sale. Seahorses could therefore be functionally extinct in 25 - 30 years* (based on 150 million + seahorses per year taken from the sea).
attributes.additional_details:
Ref: * figures from SaveourSeahorses
 
The Seahorse Trust (www.theseahorsetrust.org) has campaigned and highlighted to each online marketplace over the last twelve + months the illegality of sales of CITES-protected seahorses, but is continually ignored. It should be illegal for these adverts to be hosted by online marketplaces.

attributes.action: Put mandatory ethical labelling on all imported consumer goods
attributes.background: The British Government should introduce a compulsory ‘ethical labelling’ system on all imported items, similar to the ‘traffic-light’ system used in food.This would cover four areas of concern: worker pay; human welfare; environmental impact and animal cruelty.
attributes.additional_details: This labelling would empower shoppers who are unknowingly helping to destroy the environment and exploit some of the poorest workers in the developing world by buying products which they do not know are unethical. Industries from food to fashion are relentlessly driving for profit no matter what the cost. A new easily understood and comprehensive system of labelling would inform decisions and transform the lives of millions of people.

attributes.action: Introduce a Tax on and revoke VAT exemption for beef products
attributes.background:
Countless scientists have identified excessive beef consumption as both a major threat to our planet, and to our health. If we introduce a tax on beef products we could:

1) Decrease consumption
2) Raise money for schools and hospitals
3) Save the planet
attributes.additional_details: The specific amount for the tax should be debated in parliament, however a guideline would be 1p per gram of beef which would be charged to the retailer. This would be on top of the standard VAT rate.

attributes.action: Grant Gibraltar special designated status that would keep it within the EU.
attributes.background: Political tensions have risen again over Gibraltar's status since Brexit, & without a credible answer, we could see their people suffer the consequences of leaving the EU worse than any other place in the UK's jurisdiction.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/gibraltar-brexit-northern-ireland-border-spain-theresa-may-a8234516.html
 
http://uk.businessinsider.com/why-the-tiny-territory-of-gibraltar-could-be-the-next-sticking-point-in-brexit-negotiations-2018-6
 
http://www.gibraltarolivepress.com/2016/09/12/chief-minister-fabian-picardo-says-british-means-british-at-national-day-political-rally/

attributes.action: Raise the max speed limit on motorways to 110 mph.
attributes.background: Due to the increasing tech of today's cars it becoming more and more unsafe to have an enforced 70 mph speed limit on UK motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
70 mph speed limits were introduced in 1965 when car wheels looked more like today's bicycle wheels. Technology has moved on unbelievable amounts in the subsequent over half a century, and is tried tested and proven to be safe at speeds exceeding 70 mph.
The mixture of the 70 mph speed limit and today's tech and ease of speed in cars erodes away at our famous British ability to maintain safe lane discipline on our motorways.

attributes.action: Ensure British food standards are met in any free trade agreement with USA
attributes.background: Once 'Brexit' is complete the government will be able to seek its own Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) with other countries, most notably the USA. The USA use hormones in the rearing of their meat, Genetically Modified vegetables, and have low animal welfare requirements.
attributes.additional_details: We want all food in Britain to adhere to our standards. We do not want chicken that has been washed in chlorine, we do not want beef which has been injected with hormones, we do not want pigs who have suffered horrendous conditions to be allowed to arrive in the UK. Raising and management of animal products in this way goes against the values that the British public hold. We hold our government accountable for protecting these values.

attributes.action: Cyclists - Make it mandatory for bicycles to have registration license plates
attributes.background: After years driving on UK roads, it is a very widely known fact that it is very difficult for cyclists to be held accountable for their traffic offences, such as running through red traffic lights and riding recklessly on pavements putting pedestrians at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/08/40-cyclists-jump-red-light-in-30-seconds--video/

attributes.action: A holder of a full UK driving licence can pay to remove minor penalty points
attributes.background: To submit a change in the law where a holder of a full uk driving licence can pay £100.00 per penalty point to remove minor diving penalty points from his/her licence after a period of 6 months from the offence with the proceeds going back in to road safety, education or transportation links.
attributes.additional_details: The Uk driving licence has not been reviewed since 1988 and since this time technology has moved on as well as the public travelling more and for longer distances which means a greater risk of accumulating points of a shorter period of time which will in turn creates financial hardship and damage to the economy for many who rely on motor vehicles in the UK, The money from this change can be used to be spent on road safety and education or better transportation links.
